text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with cashew chicken that's right
another installment in our long-running
series chef john makes fake asian food
and while this is not going to be very
similar to the cashew chicken you find
at your finer chinese restaurants and
much closer to something you'd see at
the mall food court it's still a
fantastic way to use up some leftover
grilled chicken breast and with grilling
season coming up you're going to have
some leftover chicken breast on hand at
one point or another and this simple
dish is a great way to use it up so here
we go step one you're going to want to
cook too much chicken at some point so
this is me after that and then we're
going to cut that up in like 1-inch
pieces since this is already cooked we
want the pieces pretty small so they
heat through quick and of course this
will work with any kind of chicken but
leftover grilled chicken has that little
bit of smokiness that really adds
something special to this so we're going
to cut that up and at that point I'm
going to give it a dusting of salt and
pepper
the outside was season when we grilled
it but now that we've exposed all that
extra surface area I'm going to season
it up a little bit before it hits the
pan okay so our chicken is prepped and
it's on to the sauce so in a bowl you're
going to add some corn net starch along
with some cold water a little bit of
ketchup a little bit of rice vinegar
that's seasoned rice vinegar some hot
chili sauce and some brown sugar I'm
going to give that a little stir for no
apparent reason because there's more
going in this for example some soy sauce
followed by more gratuitous stirring and
then I'm also going to squeeze in the
juice of one lemon and that extremely
simple sauce is pretty much done and I'm
we're going to take our whisk and whisk
this very thoroughly well make sure all
that corn starch is dissolved
which reminds me before you add this to
the pan make sure you give it a stir
because the cornstarch will settle again
so give it a thorough whisking and we're
going to set that aside so our chickens
ready our sauce is ready finally we can
go over to the stove and start cooking
so I'm gonna put a heavy skillet on
medium-high heat I'm going to put in a
nice splash of vegetable oil and as soon
as it gets hot I'm going to throw in one
sliced red chili or any hot pepper will
work and some nice thin slices of ginger
root and I didn't even peel it I just
sliced it thin across the grain and I'm
going to sizzle that ginger and pepper
in that oil for about two minutes it's
going to infuse it with a beautiful
flavor and at that point we're going to
add the cashews
so I'm going to dump in a handful of
cashews oops
shoot that silica package fell in now
you know I didn't grow my own cashews
how embarrassing
okay so I will admit I'm using canned
dry roasted cashews I'm also going to
throw in some sliced garlic if you
wanted to mince it or crush it go ahead
but I kind of like the larger slices for
this so I sliced up a couple cloves
alright we don't want to brown the
garlic we just want to get a little bit
of toasting this on those nuts and just
continue infusing that oil with flavor
so I just stir-fried that for a couple
minutes and at that point you're going
to add your chicken and just give it a
quick toss in that flavorful oil stir it
around maybe thirty Seconds again this
is a very quick dish very quick recipe
so when you feel like that chicken has
been totally coated in that oil and it's
glistening at you quite seductively I
want you to turn the heat down to
medium-low and pour in the sauce and as
you know with any cornstarch based sauce
it's going to thicken up almost
instantly so keep stirring keep stirring
and then you're going to check for
thickness and as you're going to see I
had to add a little bit of water you
could also use stock to thin it out so
once it initially thickens up take a
look and if you have to thin it out with
a splash of water or stock go for it
no problem by the way I will adjust the
amount of water on the written
ingredients on the blog so you probably
won't have to do this but obviously
you're going to observe and adjust and
once you've adjusted the liquid levels
just continue simmering on medium-low
until the chickens heated through which
is only going to take like two minutes
because we cut it nice and small of
course you're going to taste and adjust
for seasoning it might need a little
salt or a little splash of soy you might
want a little hotter and then for the
final touch I like to throw in a nice
handful of freshly chopped cilantro
leaves really brightens it up if you
don't like it don't put it you could
also use some green onions here that
would be beautiful and once that's
stirred in you're ready to serve and
that was a beautiful dinner
those subtly smoky pieces of chicken
breast and that very simple yet
delicious sweet and sour sauce those
rich sweet cashews and you know how the
TV chefs sometimes will say a sauce is
very complex and has multiple layers of
flavor
this is not that sauce this is the
opposite but that's totally fine that's
the trade-off this is just a quick 15
minute recipe to use up some leftover
chicken we're not expecting complexity
this is not something you serve to your
Asian foodie fanatic
friends they will just bust your
dumplings because it's not authentic but
we never said it was authentic we're
just trying to use up some chicken and
we did so in a very delicious way so I
really hope you give that a try
head over to food wishes comm for all
the ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
